segments.text: I'm observing the children again, and a sense of unease washes over me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is really quite high up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His weight seems to be distributed poorly on the steps.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool's legs are visibly splayed and tilted.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It looks incredibly unstable, almost on the verge of tipping backward.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: A fall from that height onto a hard kitchen floor could be quite serious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost picture him losing his balance and tumbling down.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl nearby doesn't seem to notice the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's too focused on the cookies, I suppose.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a pang of worry for both of them in this situation.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still lost in her dish-drying trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone should really intervene before an accident happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a very precarious position he's put himself in.
segments.speaker: PAR
